alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:46PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern St. John The Baptist, west central St. Tammany, east central Livingston and southern Tangipahoa Parishes through 315 PM CDT... At 246 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Robert, or 10 miles southeast of Hammond, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Madisonville, Springfield, Robert and Killian. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 36 and 60. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 14 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. John The Baptist
